CANDIDATE 			Pablo Gil Navarro (61677)
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:			The Netherlands - Amsterdam
QUALIFICATIONS
MSc Green Chemistry and Sustainable Industrial Technology - University of York 2015
Major subjects: Principles and application of Green Chemistry, Commercialisation of Green Products and Outreach.
BSc Chemistry - University of Sevilla 2013
Major subjects: Organic Chemistry, Physical Chemistry, Analytical Chemistry, Materials Science.
Awards: Winner of the 8th Business idea model development contest (2013) organised by the University of Sevilla (Greengrow)
Languages
Spanish – Mother tongue
English – Advanced (C1-2)
German – Intermediate (B1)
Dutch – Beginner (A1-2)
CAREER SUMMARY
Nov 2017 to date Avantium Chemicals
Apr 2022 to date
Position: Business Development Manager
Project man CANDIDATE 			Pablo Gil Navarro (61677)
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:			The Netherlands - Amsterdam
QUALIFICATIONS
MSc Green Chemistry and Sustainable Industrial Technology - University of York 2015
Major subjects: Principles and application of Green Chemistry, Commercialisation of Green Products and Outreach.
BSc Chemistry - University of Sevilla 2013
Major subjects: Organic Chemistry, Physical Chemistry, Analytical Chemistry, Materials Science.
Awards: Winner of the 8th Business idea model development contest (2013) organised by the University of Sevilla (Greengrow)
Languages
Spanish – Mother tongue
English – Advanced (C1-2)
German – Intermediate (B1)
Dutch – Beginner (A1-2)
CAREER SUMMARY
Nov 2017 to date Avantium Chemicals
Apr 2022 to date
Position: Business Development Manager
Project management and market assessment for the scale-up of a novel chemical industrial plant, outreach to third parties and settling of contracts with vendors, site selection and optimization of the business case, among other tasks.
Jan 2020 to Mar 2022
Position: Project Leader
Manager of a team in charge of the development of a sustainable industrial process. Other associated duties such as contact with clients, report writing and supply management and planning.
Nov 2017 to Dec 2019
Position: Technologist
R&D of a sustainable industrial process. Various duties among which scientific research and engineering stand out.
Oct 2016 to Nov 2017 BRB International BV
Position: R&D Lab Technician
Technical and Development Support in the Lubricants, Additives and Chemicals (LAC) unit.
Feb 2016 to Apr 2016 Nova Institute GmbH
Position: Junior Market Analyst
Viability and market analysis of projects related to biorefineries and other bio-based products.
July 2013 to Sept 2013 CSIC – Spanish Research Council
Position: Jr Scientific researcher
Spanish Research Council’s Institute of Materials Science (Sevilla). Development of flexible, multifunctional optical material with the Multifunctional Optical Materials group.
COMMENT
He is an enthusiastic professional, keen on sustainability and innovative chemistry. Adaptative to change and proactive, He has developed myself within several different roles to fit to the function as needed, including project coordination, customer reporting and people management. After stays in England, Germany and several cities in the Netherlands He is used to working in an international environment. He has shown to be passionate, hardworking and ambitious throughout my working experience. I consider myself very open-minded and flexible, while also being decisive and taking organization roles in team dynamics.
Soft Skills
Strong communication and organizational skills, developed through his work experience.
Very good at adapting to multicultural environments.
Team player, focused and efficiency-driven. Project management and monitorization experience
Computer Skills
Wide Office knowledge (Outlook, Teams, Word, Excel, Powerpoint) and other additional apps (Project, Visio).
Good command at useful programs in the scientific field as Origin or Mathematica.
Knowledge of coding in: VB.NET (Macros, etc.), Python, HTML5 Basic level Adobe Photoshop
For further information please contact Julie Smith or Jan Johnston on 01695 570 696 or email julie.smith@johnston-vere.co.uk

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
